newsitem.title: FRANCE: Economist sees renewed UK EMU debate if stg gains.
newsitem.headline: Economist sees renewed UK EMU debate if stg gains.

text.p: Britain could be forced back into the debate on joining the first wave of EMU if sterling extends its recent appreciation over the next few weeks, Deutsche Bank chief economist Norbert Walter said on Wednesday.
"If the British pound moves to 3.20 marks probably the manufacturing industry of the UK will not be pleased and they may ask their prime minister to reconsider the view," he said.
"So it might not be the City of London who pushes for inclusion but the manufacturing industry," he told a fund management conference.
He said Wednesday's UK budget would find it difficult to put fiscal restrictions in place that would avoid further interest rate increases.
"I think a higher pound is probable and therefore the problem I have described is a practical one."
